description: {"blocks":[{"key":"mbkn","text":"This SARS-CoV-2 targeted, a rapid viral RNA library preparation kit compatible with Illumina sequencers, provides an approximately five hour turn-around time from viral RNA sample to sequencing. The kit includes cDNA synthesis, SARS-CoV-2 enrichment, and library amplification and indexing reagents. The Enhanced protocol removes the need for normalization and quantification prior to amplification and indexing. RNA input is 5 μl, regardless of SC2 viral load in the sample extract. Amplification is performed using two primer pools that produce overlapping amplicons that are approximately 250 bp in size; as a result, no fragmentation is necessary prior to sequencing on Illumina platforms. 10 bp unique dual indexes (UDIs) are provided in the kit, and with a cycle read length of 149 for each paired-end read, the sequencing time is just over 28 hours.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: QIASeq Direct SARS COV-2, Miseq, SARSCOV-2 Enrichment

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3oi1","text":"With the plate still on the magnetic stand, add 200 µl of 80% ethanol. Wait 1 min and carefully remove and discard the wash. Repeat the wash, for a total of 2 ethanol washes. Remove excess ethanol as much as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68ak9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6ori","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em7g8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"do3b0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":11,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"au3fl","text":"Important: To, completely remove all traces of the ethanol wash after the second wash, immediately briefly centrifuge and return the tubes to the magnetic stand. {"blocks":[{"key":"742te","text":"Remove the plate from the magnetic stand and elute the DNA from the beads by adding 30 μl nuclease-free water. “Gently yet thoroughly” vortex (triturate if necessary) to mix, briefly centrifuge, incubate for 2 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2a1ar","text":"Centrifuge the plate until the beads are pelleted (2 min), and then return the plate to the magnetic rack until the solution has cleared.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f1kgr","text":"Transfer 28 μl to a clean plate. This is now “enriched SARS-CoV-2”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ajtq","text":"Proceed to “Library Amplification and Indexing Procedure”. Alternatively, the samples can be stored at –30 to –15°C in a constant-temperature freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fke62","text":"Incubate the mixture for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1il4","text":"Centrifuge the plate until the beads are pelleted (2 min), and then place the plate onto a magnetic rack. After the solution has cleared (2 min or longer), carefully remove and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3sog","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3j1l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":11,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"5bp05","text":"Important: Do not discard the beads as they contain the DNA of interest.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9efj7","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8bdi6","text":"Tip: It may be valuable to discard the supernatant twice. The contents settle after the first discard.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnl9g","text":"With the plate still on the magnetic stand, add 200 μl of 80% ethanol. Wait 1 min and carefully remove and discard the wash. Repeat the wash, for a total of 2 ethanol washes. Remove excess ethanol as much as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfbdu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a89tu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":11,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"135l3","text":"Important: To completely remove all traces of the ethanol wash after the second wash, immediately briefly centrifuge and return the plate to the magnetic stand. Remove the ethanol with a 200 μl pipette first, and then use a 10 μl pipette to remove any residual ethanol. This should be done quickly.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45l30","text":"With the plate still on the magnetic stand, air-dry at room temperature for 4–8 min (until the beads start to crack and pellet loses its shine).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"303a3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l35u","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bo9v7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"6366D2A080BD11EC9189EF0635D2AF99","height":305,"id":204555,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":85,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"blssd","text":"Air dry the beads until ALL EtOH is removed and the beads appear cracked (see image).","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ful9m","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":1,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":153,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7940d","text":"To check  pellets, turn tube around and look at pellet from back. Holding tubes in front of a sheet of white paper increases ability to visualize cracks.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gh2pbns2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gh2mbns2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gh2nbns2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gh2kbns2x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fic4t","text":"Remove the plate from the magnetic stand and elute the DNA from the beads by adding 25 μl nuclease-free water. Vigorously vortex (triturate if necessary) to mix, briefly centrifuge, and incubate for 2 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6pscd","text":"Centrifuge the plate until the beads are pelleted (2 min), and then return the plate to the magnetic rack until the solution has cleared (2 min or longer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8j6uu","text":"Transfer 23 μl to a clean plate. This is the “SARS-CoV-2 library”. If not proceeding immediately, the sample can be stored at –30 to –15°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1trkn","text":"Quantify the library using Qubit HS assay kit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ane03","text":"Assess the quality of the library using a Bioanalyzer, TapeStation (D1000 tape), or Fragment Analyzer. Check for the expected size distribution of library fragments. An example library is shown here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8bmtu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dqvap","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"dtm8f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"983BC8D080BA11EC9189EF0635D2AF99","height":247,"id":204559,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gh2tbns2x.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gh2rbns2x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gh2sbns2x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gh2qbns2x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dcg13","text":"Using the attached Post library worksheet, calculate the nM based on the Qubit concentration (ng/ul) and the Tape station (bp) profile. Normalize the “SARS-CoV-2 library”, to 4 nM. Quantify the final pool at the end. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83ncq","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1to72","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"7E30A300821A11ECAFBACD6CFAE20D9F","id":204325,"original_name":"Postlibraryworksheet.xlsx","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghtfbns2x.xlsx"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qups","text":" Proceed to loading on to MiSeq (150x 150 cycle) using the attached Sample Sheet. Alternatively, the purified “SARS-CoV-2 library” can be safely stored at –30 to –15°C in a constant-temperature freezer until ready to use for sequencing.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":236,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c1bav","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"59B9A7F0821B11ECAFBACD6CFAE20D9F","id":204327,"original_name":"SampleSheet.csv","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ghthbns2x.csv"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86ja0","text":"Important Notes: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61can","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apfq6","text":"We are adding tails ONLY to SARS-CoV-2 sequence in the subsequent Library Amplification and Indexing Procedure, and that will keep all the contaminants at bay when you perform your final amplification.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":201}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fofj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"18j43","text":"So, after  you transferred the 28 µl of supernatant from your elution, this is a good time to get a feel for what you have if you want to do a mid-protocol check.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":162}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44sq7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oj6f","text":"Use a high sensitivity Qubit (for example) and check the concentration of the enrichment reactions after bead cleanup.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":118}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eced2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nvo","text":"With wastewater samples anything that is 1ng/µl and above (even down to 0.5ng/µl with high Ct values) is a success and should definitely  move on to final amplification!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":169}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
